back_translation_en: The handkerchief got soaked from tears.

back_translation_en: Because of the darkness the shore isn’t visible.

back_translation_en: Due to the darkness the shore isn't visible.

comments_informal: mistakenly (> make.a.mistake-CVB)

back_translation_en: The tree fell because of the wind.

back_translation_en: The man died immediately from electric shock.

back_translation_en: The woman woke up from the noise.
back_translation_ru: Женщина проснулась от шума.

back_translation_en: The man has a headache from the beer.

back_translation_en: The woman laughed at the puppy.
back_translation_ru: Женщина рассмеялась из-за щенка.
comments_informal: One informant assessed such usage of the accusative marker as ungrammatical, but it is well attested in the corpus. In any case o is not used a causal marker with other verbs.

sentence: Dansei-wa dokusei-no sakana-o tabe-te futsuka-go-ni shin-da.
glosses_en: man-TOP poisonousness-GEN fish-ACC eat-CVB two_days-later-DAT die-PST
back_translation_en: The man ate a poisonous fish and died two days later.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина съел ядовитую рыбу и умер два дня спустя.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.

back_translation_en: The girl is satisfied with her grade.
back_translation_ru: Девочка удовлетворена своей оценкой.
comments_informal: In this case ni seems to be governed by the verb and doesn’t seem to express reason per se.

back_translation_en: The wife was angered by her husband’s words.
back_translation_ru: Жена разозлилась на слова мужа.
comments_informal: In this case the dative NP is more of an adjunct rather than an argument.

back_translation_en: The boy was thrilled by this idea.

back_translation_en: The child hid in the barn out of fear.

back_translation_en: The woman can’t fall asleep because of the mosquitoes.

back_translation_en: The water looks bright because of the moonlight.

back_translation_en: Thanks to his dog, the man had a successful hunt.

back_translation_en: All misfortunes happen because of humans/people.

sentence: Shujutsu-no okage-de dansei-wa yo-ku mie-ru yō-ni nat-ta.
glosses_en: operation-GEN thanks_to-INS man-TOP good-ADV be_able_to_see-PRS way-DAT become-PST
back_translation_en: The man can see better now thanks to the operation.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина стал лучше видеть благодаря операции.

back_translation_en: The woman is alive thanks to that man.
back_translation_ru: Женщина жива благодаря этому мужчине.

sentence: Dansei-wa tsuma-ni orokasa-kara sono koto-o it-ta.
glosses_en: man-TOP wife-DAT stupidity-ABL this matter-ACC say-PST
back_translation_en: The man told his wife about it out of stupidity.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина рассказал об этом жене по глупости.

back_translation_en: The woman slipped because of carelessness.
back_translation_ru: Женщина поскользнулась по неосторожности.

back_translation_en: The woman slipped because of carelessness.
back_translation_ru: Женщина поскользнулась по неосторожности.
comments_informal: In the corpus the ablative marker is used with this noun twice as rarely as the instrumental one. One out of four participants used this marker.

back_translation_en: The pilot was able to land [the plane] thanks to his experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот смог совершить посадку благодаря своему опыту.
comments_informal: Two informants out of four have tranlsated the stimuli (one from English and one from Russian) with this marker, but in the corpus there are no instances of this marker being used with this noun.

back_translation_en: The pilot succeeded in landing [the plane] thanks to his experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот смог успешно совершил посадку благодаря своему опыту.
comments_informal: Even though there are 52 instances of this marker being used with this noun in the corpus, only one informant used it in the translation of the English stimulus.

back_translation_en: The pilot couldn’t land [the plane] due to the lack of experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот не смог посадить самолет из-за нехватки опыта.
comments_informal: Two informants out of four have tranlsated the stimuli (one from English and one from Russian) with this marker, but in the corpus there are no instances of this marker being used with this noun. This marker seems to be used in more formal discourse.

back_translation_en: The pilot couldn’t land [the plane] due to the lack of experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот не смог посадить самолет из-за нехватки опыта.
comments_informal: Even though there are 297 instances of this marker being used with this noun (busoku 'lack') in the corpus, only one informant used it in the translation of the Russian stimulus.

sentence: Josei-wa e-ni hik-are-te sono hon-o kat-ta.
glosses_en: woman-TOP picture-DAT attract-PASS-CVB this book-ACC buy-PST

comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.

sentence: Josei-wa shashin-no tame-ni sono hon-o kōnyū-sh-ita.

sentence: Sūgaku-teki riron-ni yotte kono sūji-wa ichi-miman-ni-wa nar-ana-i.
glosses_en: mathematics-REL theory-DAT due this number-TOP one-less-DAT-TOP become-NEG-PRS

back_translation_ru: Это число не может быть меньше единицы в силу математических законов.

sentence: Sūgaku-teki hōsoku-no tame kono sūji-wa ichi-miman-ni-wa nar-ana-i.
